item.title: C++: Little teaser about std::set
item.author: julio@meroh.net (Julio Merino)
item.description:
This does not build. Can you guess why? Without testing it?
std::set< int > numbers;

for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
 numbers.insert(i);

for (std::set< int >::iterator iter = numbers.begin();
 iter != numbers.end(); iter++) {
 int& i = *iter;
 i++;
}
Update (23:40): John gave a correct answer in the comments.
